nodes.bodyText:
This method already is too big imo. I also think we should move most of the code here into the CourseService, as logic like this should not be in a resource. Could you please start by just moving your code there? You also have some code duplication here, so you can just use the same method twice with a parameter ComplaintType complaintType.
In fact, I would move the complaint related requests to the complaint service

@maxr96 I just saw now that you are also refactoring CourseResource in #1149 . Is it ok if I apply these changes suggested by @ungaralex  here or would this be conflicting with the changes you had in mind for your PR?
@HanyaElhashemy no this will not conflict my changes. You can apply them here or we can also discuss this after developers meeting.
I agree, we should ignore complaints related to the tutor's assessment and subtract them from the overall number

The only reason I did not add the property numberOfTutorComplaints to the subtraction in stats.setNumberOfOpenComplaints yet and left the comment in the code instead is because numberOfTutorComplaints is currently a bit buggy and will be fixed in #1143

Aren't you two contradicting each other? Alex wants to exclude the complaints of the tutor himself and Hanya wants to include it. Or am I misunderstanding something?
I guess if the tutor should not know if there are any complaints about his assessments (or how many), it makes sense to exclude those.

As discussed before the meeting, we both actually mean the same thing but I guess my Todo was a bit unclear, I will rephrase it. And I also suggest that the property numberOfTutorComplaints should be renamed to nrOfComplaintsAboutOwnAssessment in #1143 to avoid any misunderstanding
Same comment as for the CourseResource
I would argue that we can just remove all these inputs from the component since it already has the whole exercise as an input

                             [tutorParticipation]="exercise.tutorParticipations[0]"
                             [numberOfParticipations]="exercise.numberOfParticipations"

+                            [numberOfComplaints]="exercise.numberOfComplaints"

nodes.bodyText: I think the reason for this is that jhi-tutor-participation-graph is used in a different way in tutor-exercise-dashboard.component.html where those numbers are not taken from the exercise but are retrieved separately from the /api/exercises/{exerciseId}/stats-for-tutor-dashboard endpoint.

@@ -102,6 +102,10 @@ <h2>
                             [tutorParticipation]="exercise.tutorParticipations[0]"
                             [numberOfParticipations]="exercise.numberOfParticipations"
                             [numberOfAssessments]="exercise.numberOfAssessments"
+                            [numberOfComplaints]="exercise.numberOfComplaints"

nodes.bodyText:
Ok, I only saw this now. So we already have this functionality in the stats-for-tutor-dashboard call, but you basically now do the same thing again for the fort-tutor-dashboard call. The question is then if we really need this code in both endpoints, or if one is sufficient. If we need it in both, then we should really refactor the server code into the {Course,Complaints}Services.
Furthermore, I looked into the CourseResource and we don't even populate the numberOfOpenComplaints and numberOfOpenFeedbackRequests fields in this case. We only do this in the stats-for-instructor-dashboard call (at least in the CourseResource. Please have a look at this process again and make it consistent.
Ah, never mind my other comment then :D

@ungaralex I agree with you, the server code needs to be refactored, and as we saw together on Tuesday, it is a bit more complex and out of the scope of this PR, as I didn't really add much to it. So is it ok for you if we refactor the server code for dashboard stats in a separate PR?
Yes, as discussed I think it's fine if we create an issue for this and postpone this to a future PR
Since this is basically the same code as above, we can refactor this into a small subcomponent.
